page.title: 20Pressures on Wyre Forest
page.content: The ancient woods West of the river are of great interest scientifically and historically, and this, together with the tourism promoted by the town of Bewdley, means that they are subjected to pressures by the public. Conservationists believe that this is not desirable and that even very keen naturalists could be a threat. They are always vigilant and the Wyre Forest Society exists for this reason. Picnickers,walkers and horse riders expect access, and T.A. exercises, car rallies and sponsored walks have been organised. Vandals and poachers have to be dealt with. Conflict naturally exists between commercial,conservation and recreational interests, but the Forestry Commission attempts to maintain a good balance. { Prepared by members of Wolverley { Women's Institute. }
